burlap.datastructures

Class StochasticTree<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.datastructures.StochasticTree<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - any Java object that will be sampled

    public class StochasticTree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for performing sampling of a set of objects at O(lg(n)) time. Elements can be added and removed dynamically. The "weights" of the objects should be positive values, but do not have to specify a probability distribution. The sampling will be performed according to the relative weight of all objects.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      A class for storing a stochastic tree node.

      • changeWeight

        public void changeWeight(T element,
                double w)
        Changes the weight of the given element. For this operation to be supported T must be hashable.
        Parameters:
        element - the element whose weight should be changed.
        w - the new weight of the element.

      • sample

        public T sample()
        Samples an element according to a probability defined by the relative weight of objects from the tree and returns it
        Returns:
        a sampled element

      • poll

        public T poll()
        Samples an element according to a probability defined by the relative weight of objects, removes it from the tree, and returns it.
        Returns:
        a sampled element
